reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Courtyard for two nights in April, 2012. The hotel is two exists or 5 minutes from all the buzz of downtown Asheville. The king size bed was very comfortable and the shower had great water pressure! The elevator was quick and the staff was friendly. You can't go wrong by staying here.
reviews.title: Very Convenient to Downtown Asheville

reviews.text: I reserved two rooms at this hotel through the Biltmore area hotel package. Although i would've preferred to stay at the Biltmore Inn. When i was doing my research through Biltmore's website they said that this hotel is only 4 miles to the mansion. I find that quite deceiving because it was clearly more than that. It took us 15mins to get to the mansion from our hotel. Nevertheless, we enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were decent in size. Although it would be nice to have queen rather than double sized mattress. The rooms were clean and the housekeeping did a great job on keeping it tidy every single day. The free breakfast were good, you have a lot of options to choose from. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel like I said is about 15mins to the mansion if youre going that way. But the surrounding area have some good restaurants like Carrabas to name a few, a decent sized mall and a grocery. We had a very relaxing experience and i wouldnt want it any other way even if i can afford to stay at the Bitmore Inn. Thank you so much for making our spring break get away memorable.
reviews.title: A good place to stay if youre visiting Biltmore Mansion

reviews.text: Purchased a stay at this hotel through Biltmore Getaways. We saved a little money but would have liked to be a little closer to the Biltmore. About 15 minutes away with lights and traffic. But the breakfast cafe was a nice bonus and the employees working in the cafe were really friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great location and staff. Rooms updated recently!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has been updated recently including the pool and lobby. Our room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was a good size except there was a little mold in the tub. Slight view of the mountains.
reviews.title: Great Location, great staff, great accomodations

reviews.text: I would suggest changing the two double beds to two queens to give guests more room. We would stay here again but would consider a hotel closer to the Biltmore for convenience.
reviews.title: Great stay for the price.
A Cleaner Balcony and Jacuzzi Would Have Been Nice
reviews.text: This is a typical Courtyard. We upgraded to a room with a jacuzzi and balcony.

The balcony was extremely narrow and covered with dead bugs. The balcony was so narrow that you really couldn't move the chairs to look directly at the mountains. The chairs would only fit sideways on the balcony so you had to stare at the wall.
reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.text: We didn't use the jacuzzi because the jets were dirty.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: We stayed here for a volleyball tournament in April. We had 2 rooms. One was a 2 room king suite, which was very spacious and had a cute balcony. The second room had 2 queens, and was also very comfortable (I know because I slept in both.)
reviews.title: Room not cleaned 2nd day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The updated lobby was identical to one we stayed at in Louisville. It has kind of a retro feel which is nice. We didn't really make use of the restaurant/bistro in the lobby but did grab a breakfast sandwich there one morning. It was just so-so. However we did eat at Vinnys Neigjborhood Italian restaurant on Merrimon Avenue in Asheville and the food was excellent. We also had a team dinner one night for 25 people at Carrabas next to the hotel and they were very accommodating. I'm normally not a fan of chain Italian, but the food was good. (We devoured the warm bread.)
reviews.title: Coupled with a trip to Biltmore Estate (Package)

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott Courtyard recently, while the lobby area had been updated the rooms were terrible. Paint was chipping on the doorframes, the grout in the bathroom was filthy and the bathrubs were pink something left over from an older hotel. Way over priced for the quality and not up the Marriotts standards. The breakfasts were over priced as well. In addition the maid changed the towels but forgot to make the bed the two days were were there.
reviews.title: Overpriced and out dated

reviews.text: decent location and large room/good value. but walls are thin and heard TV fm adjacent room--interfered with trying to sleep.
reviews.title: ok hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on a vacation to see The Biltmore Estate with my husband. Very good location which was within 10 minutes to everything including downtown Asheville, The Biltmore and Biltmore Village. Parking was free.
reviews.title: Very good location

reviews.text: We had a beautiful view of the mountains from our window.
reviews.title: Just Okay

reviews.text: The room was clean and the bed comfortable. Looks like the rooms were recently redone.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay

reviews.text: Public areas (lobby, patio, pool) very inviting and comfortable. Exercise room a bit cramped. The guestroom was as expected for a Courtyard - nothing more. The best thing about this hotel is it's location. Zip through the tunnel and you're in the historic area in no time!
reviews.title: Convenient to historic downtown Asheville

reviews.text: This courtyard is great becuz of the outdoor fireplace...clean rooms and great staff...
reviews.title: 4th July in Asheville

reviews.text: It is by the mall if you are there for the mall...
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.text: My friend and I decided to stay here at the last minute during our travel home. We were very impressed with the facility. The room was clean, and the lobby and seating area outside were comfortable. The security/maintenance man was really nice. We chatted for a few minutes, then he left us to enjoy the lovely evening in Asheville. Also, the front desk clerk was very helpful.
reviews.title: Nice hotel after remodeling

reviews.text: Nice contemporary design inside free wifi and clean new rooms
